Grouped_Utterances: That's understandable. Last time, we talked a bit about your feelings of motivation and how you sometimes feel you settle for less. It’s been okay. I still think about her sometimes, but I’m trying to move on.

Great! It might help you feel less isolated. Speaking of feelings, how have you been sleeping lately? Pretty well, actually. I’ve been trying to keep a regular schedule. That’s wonderful to hear! That’s a good approach. Staying connected with friends can provide support. Have you had any conversations with them about how you’re feeling? Yeah, I think I could try that.

That makes sense. It can be really daunting to figure out what you want, especially when there are so many options. Have you considered trying to set smaller goals to help clarify what you want? Focusing on smaller, achievable goals can help create a sense of accomplishment. What’s one small step you think you could take toward figuring things out? Maybe just making a list of things I’m interested in? That seems manageable. That’s a great idea! Writing things down can often help clarify your thoughts. Would you be willing to share that list in our next session? Sure, I can do that. Absolutely, every small step counts. It’s all about progress, not perfection. That sounds like a solid plan. Remember to be gentle with yourself as you navigate these feelings. It’s okay to take your time.
